content.question: The particles in solid <math alttext="K I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, a stable ionic compound, are arranged to maximize coulombic attractions while minimizing coulombic repulsions among the particles. Which of the following diagrams best represents the structure of solid <math alttext="K I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KI</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: The figure presents 6 particles in a 3 by 2 rectangular array. From left to right, the charges of the top row of particles are positive, negative, and positive. From left to right, the charges of the bottom row of particles are negative, positive, and negative. The particles are not in contact with each other.

The figure presents 6 particles in a 3 by 2 rectangular array. The top row of particles are each positively charged, and the bottom row of particles are each negatively charged. The particles are not in contact with each other.

The figure presents 6 particles in a 3 by 2 rectangular array. The top row of particles are each positively charged, and the bottom row of particles are each negatively charged. Each particle in the top row is in contact with the particle below it in the bottom row.
